oneOf.description: A timePeriod with a startDateTime and/or endDateTime.
oneOf.title: dateTime

___startDateTime.description: Starting date, or date and time.

___endDateTime.description: Ending date, or date and time.

$eref.description: Defines a length of time in specific units.

___units.description: The unit of time for the interval.

$eref.description: Object for collecting information about a duration or period of time.

oneOf.description: A timePeriod with a startGeologicAge and/or endGeologicAge.
oneOf.title: geologicAge

$eref.description: A name, code, or date describing an event or period in geologic time, expressed either as an absolute date calculated using a named dating method, or as a relative date that is drawn from stratigraphy or biostratigraphy.
$eref.title: geologicAge

___ageEstimate.description: Either an absolute geologic date or a relative geologic age name describing an event or period in geologic time based on the Geologic_Time_Scale.

___ageExplanation.description: The name and/or description of the method used to calculate the ageEstimate. Detailed information about the method may be provided through references contained in the ageReference.

___ageUncertainty.description: The error estimate for the geologic time. This should include the units of measure, a description of what the error estimate represents and how it was calculated.

___ageTimeScale.description: Name of a recognized geologic time scale. This includes "Absolute" as the name of the time scale for measuring geologic dates before the present and names of geologic dating systems that are arrangements of symbols or names in order of relative geologic time

___ageReference.description: Citation for works providing detailed information about any element of the geologicAge.

___endGeologicAge.description: A name, code, or date for the end of an event or period in geologic time.

$eref.description: A name, code, or date describing an event or period in geologic time, expressed either as an absolute date calculated using a named dating method, or as a relative date that is drawn from stratigraphy or biostratigraphy.
$eref.title: geologicAge

___ageEstimate.description: Either an absolute geologic date or a relative geologic age name describing an event or period in geologic time based on the Geologic_Time_Scale.

___ageExplanation.description: The name and/or description of the method used to calculate the ageEstimate. Detailed information about the method may be provided through references contained in the ageReference.

___ageUncertainty.description: The error estimate for the geologic time. This should include the units of measure, a description of what the error estimate represents and how it was calculated.

___ageTimeScale.description: Name of a recognized geologic time scale. This includes "Absolute" as the name of the time scale for measuring geologic dates before the present and names of geologic dating systems that are arrangements of symbols or names in order of relative geologic time

___ageReference.description: Citation for works providing detailed information about any element of the geologicAge.

___startGeologicAge.description: A name, code, or date for the beginning of an event or period in geologic time.

description: A span of time represented by a starting date-time and an ending date-time.

_88timeInterval.description: Defines a length of time in specific units.

___units.description: The unit of time for the interval.

_88duration.description: Object for collecting information about a duration or period of time.

___description.description: A brief description providing relevant information about the time period.

___periodName.description: Names associated with the time period.

___description.description: A natural language description of the meaning of the identifier value.

___namespace.description: A string which unambiguously defines the namespace for the identifier.

___identifier.description: A name that is used to identify the resource.

___authority.description: Citation for the authority issuing the identifier.

___id.description: A unique identifier for a time period.
